title: [Large-Scale] Cognitive Processing-Based Mathematical Education Design for Senior Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Mathematical Concepts and Core Principles of Instructional Design
context.additional_context: Emphasis on practical mathematics applications tailored to learnersâ€™ professional backgrounds (medical/legal/technical)

learning_goals: Design and explanation of three or more mathematics teaching strategies tailored to the cognitive processing characteristics of elderly learners

Learners can develop two types of mathematical activity modules for solving daily life problems (e.g., budget management, discount calculation) within a 4-week mid-term course and submit them after achieving at least 4 points (out of 5) in each of the three expert evaluation rubric criteria: goal alignment, practicality, and clarity.
Production of age-friendly learning materials through application of cognitive load theory
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
